verbs.description: overqualify (third-person singular simple present overqualifies, present participle overqualifying, simple past and past participle overqualified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give excessive academic qualifications to.
examples: […]  remember it is better to overqualify advisers than to make assumptions about their abilities.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To modify, restrict or moderate (a statement, etc.) excessively.
examples: I do have a tendency sometimes to overqualify what I am saying or labour the point.
